Question: How to create the data management plan?
Ground Truth: Creating data management plan. Create the data management plan using either the Word template at the bottom of this page or with the DPM Tuuli data management planning tool. They both contain instructions. Find the link to DMP Tuuli from the links-list. Login to the DMP Tuuli tool with your Jamk credentials. The first time, the ID must be registered, and Jamk University of Applied Sciences must be selected as the organization. In the future, the user can log in directly through Haka under Sign in with your institutional credentials. This is how you find the Jamkâ€™s template: select Create a new plan, write Jamk University of Applied Sciences as a research organization, check the box No funder associated, and finally select the template of Jamk. The plan created in the program can be shared in different file formats and shared with other users, for example to the thesis tutor or another thesis author.

Question: What does phase 2 of the thesis process include?
Ground Truth: Phase 2 (Two thirds of thesis completed) - Thesis implementation. Bachelor 6 ECTS credits = 162 working hours. If you do your thesis 15 hours a week, it will take 10-11 weeks. Master 10 ECTS credits = 270 working hours. If you do your thesis 15 hours a week, it will take 18 weeks.

Question: How to name thesis when the work has only one author?
Ground Truth: If the work has only one author, the filename is: Lastname_Firstname
